meta.title: Family and Kinship
meta.note: Heavy T3 lesson (7 characters) - excellent zombie/groan practice

characters.etymology: Second Heavenly Stem - a curved hook, the second in the cycle
characters.pithy_formula: SECOND place - I GROAN 'Yeee...' in low, bitter defeat.
characters.story: I came in SECOND. Not first - SECOND. I GROAN 'Yeee...' in low, creaky bitterness. The hook of defeat curves around my heart. Almost glory, but not quite.

similar_warning.repulsion: 乙 curves RIGHT (second place); 九 hooks LEFT (number nine)

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a baby with arms outstretched
characters.pithy_formula: The CHILD reaches up and GROANS 'Dzuuu...' wanting to be held.
characters.story: The CHILD reaches up with tiny arms, GROANING 'Dzuuu...' in low, needy desperation. Pick me up. Hold me. The zombie-baby wants flesh - I mean, comfort.

similar_warning.repulsion: 子 has ARMS (living child); 了 lost its arms (action finished/dead)

characters.etymology: Child (子) + hook (乚) = hole/cavity (also Confucius's surname 孔子)
characters.pithy_formula: I peer into the dark HOLE and GROAN 'Kohhhng...' - what's inside?
characters.story: I peer into the dark HOLE in the ground and GROAN 'Kohhhng...' in low dread. The CAVITY echoes back - something moves down there. My creaky voice trembles.

similar_warning.repulsion: 孔 = HOLE (cavity); 吼 adds MOUTH (口) = ROAR (sound from cavity)

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + cavity (孔) = to roar (sound resonating from deep cavity)
characters.pithy_formula: I ROAR from deep in my chest - 'Hohhhh...' GROANS out like thunder.
characters.story: I ROAR from the cavity of my chest, GROANING 'Hohhhh...' in a low, rumbling thunder. The sound echoes from deep within - a zombie's battle cry, creaky and primal.

similar_warning.repulsion: 吼 = ROAR (mouth + cavity = sound); 孔 = HOLE (silent cavity)

characters.etymology: Child (子) without arms = finished, completed (the action is done)
characters.pithy_formula: Done. Finished. I mutter 'luh' - action COMPLETED, nothing more.
characters.story: The task is COMPLETED. I mutter 'luh' with neutral indifference - done, finished, over. The child lost its arms; the action lost its life. Just 'luh' and move on.

similar_warning.repulsion: 了 = COMPLETED (armless, finished); 子 = CHILD (arms reaching, alive)

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a woman kneeling - ancient character for female
characters.pithy_formula: The WOMAN rises from the grave and GROANS 'Nyuuu...' for vengeance.
characters.story: The WOMAN rises from her grave, GROANING 'Nyuuu...' in low, creaky fury. She was wronged in life - now she returns, zombie-slow, seeking what was stolen from her.

similar_warning.repulsion: 女 = WOMAN (plain form); 母 = MOTHER (two dots = breasts for nursing)

characters.etymology: Woman (女) + child (子) = good (a woman with her child = happiness)
characters.pithy_formula: WOMAN and CHILD together - I GROAN 'Howww...' It's GOOD but exhausting.
characters.story: The WOMAN holds her CHILD and I GROAN 'Howww...' in low exhaustion. It's GOOD - love is good - but I'm so tired. Zombie-parent mode: creaky joy, bone-deep fatigue.

characters.etymology: Woman (女) + mouth (口) = to be like (a woman speaks comparison)
characters.pithy_formula: She's LIKE me? I GASP 'ROO?!' in rising shock at the resemblance!
characters.story: She looks LIKE me! I GASP 'ROO?!' in rising shock - the woman speaks and I hear my own voice. AS IF looking in a mirror. My startled cry climbs upward.

characters.etymology: Woman (女) with two dots representing breasts = mother (one who nurses)
characters.pithy_formula: MOTHER calls from the darkness - I GROAN 'Mooo...' and shamble toward her.
characters.story: MOTHER calls my name from the shadows. I GROAN 'Mooo...' and shamble toward her voice like a zombie to its maker. Low, creaky longing - even the dead need their mothers.

similar_warning.repulsion: 母 = MOTHER (two dots = breasts for nursing); 女 = WOMAN (no dots)

characters.etymology: Thread (毋) + shell (貝) = to pierce (string shells on a cord)
characters.pithy_formula: I PIERCE the shells on a string and COMMAND 'GWAHN!' - threaded through!
characters.story: I PIERCE each shell and thread it onto the cord, COMMANDING 'GWAHN!' with sharp satisfaction. The string punches through - shells become money, chaos becomes order.

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + legs (儿) = elder brother (one who speaks with authority, stands tall)
characters.pithy_formula: ELDER BROTHER stands tall and SINGS 'SHYOHHHNG!' - protector supreme!
characters.story: My ELDER BROTHER stands before me and SINGS 'SHYOHHHNG!' in a sustained note of authority. He speaks for the family, stands tall on strong legs - my protector forever.

similar_warning.repulsion: 兄 = ELDER BROTHER (mouth speaks); 克 = OVERCOME (ten on top conquers)

characters.etymology: Ten (十) on top of brother variant = to overcome (conquering force)
characters.pithy_formula: I OVERCOME my enemy and COMMAND 'KUH!' - conquered and crushed!
characters.story: I OVERCOME my enemy with ten times the force, COMMANDING 'KUH!' as they fall. Conquered, crushed, finished - my sharp bark of victory echoes over the defeated.

similar_warning.repulsion: 克 = OVERCOME (ten conquers from above); 兄 = BROTHER (mouth speaks below)

lesson_palace.description: A family shrine where generations gather - living and dead, protectors and protected

character_stations.乙: Second-place trophy: bitter silver medal on the wall
character_stations.子: Nursery corner: baby arms reaching from the crib
character_stations.孔: Confucius altar: dark hole where wisdom echoes
character_stations.吼: Tiger painting: roar emanates from the canvas
character_stations.了: Completed tasks board: finished and forgotten
character_stations.好: Family portrait: exhausted mother holding child
character_stations.母: Mother's shrine: her voice calls from shadows
character_stations.貫: Money-stringing table: shells pierced on cords
character_stations.克: Victory wall: conquered enemies' names carved

quality_summary.note: Heavy T3 lesson - excellent practice for zombie/groan system
